DataElement.preferredName: Index Lesion Response irRC Measurable Response Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The disease response in the largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy using the Immune-Related Response Criteria (irRC).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Index Lesion Measurable Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._The largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy._Capable of being measured._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredDefinition: The largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy.:Capable of being measured.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: The most clinically significant tumor lesion targeted by therapy. The lesion is typically the largest or highest graded of the tumor foci detected.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Guidelines for the Evaluation of Immune Therapy Activity in Solid Tumors: Immune-Related Response Criteria. (Wolchok JD, Hoos A, O'Day S, Weber JS, Hamid O, Lebbe C, Maio M, Binder M, Bohnsack O, Nichol G, Humphrey R, Hodi FS. Guidelines for the Evaluation of Immune Therapy Activity in Solid Tumors: Immune-Related Response Criteria. Clin Cancer Res. 2009 Dec 1;15(23):7412-20.)_Capable of being measured._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Complete disappearance of all lesions (whether measurable or not, and no new lesions); confirmation by a repeat, consecutive assessment no less than 4 weeks from the date first documented.

Concepts.definition: Complete disappearance of all lesions (whether measurable or not, and no new lesions); confirmation by a repeat, consecutive assessment no less than 4 weeks from the date first documented.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Increase in tumor burden greater than or equal to 25 percent relative to nadir (minimum recorded tumor burden); confirmation by a repeat, consecutive assessment no less than 4 weeks from the date first documented.

Concepts.definition: Increase in tumor burden greater than or equal to 25 percent relative to nadir (minimum recorded tumor burden); confirmation by a repeat, consecutive assessment no less than 4 weeks from the date first documented.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Decrease in tumor burden greater than or equal to 50 percent relative to baseline confirmed by a consecutive assessment at least 4 weeks after first documentation.

Concepts.definition: Decrease in tumor burden greater than or equal to 50 percent relative to baseline confirmed by a consecutive assessment at least 4 weeks after first documentation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not meeting criteria for irCR or irPR, in absence of irPD.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting criteria for irCR or irPR, in absence of irPD.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Wolchok Solid Tumors 2009 Oncology Response Criteria Measurable Response Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Guidelines for the Evaluation of Immune Therapy Activity in Solid Tumors: Immune-Related Response Criteria. (Wolchok JD, Hoos A, O'Day S, Weber JS, Hamid O, Lebbe C, Maio M, Binder M, Bohnsack O, Nichol G, Humphrey R, Hodi FS. Guidelines for the Evaluation of Immune Therapy Activity in Solid Tumors: Immune-Related Response Criteria. Clin Cancer Res. 2009 Dec 1;15(23):7412-20.):Capable of being measured.:Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.longName: Wolchok Solid Tumors 2009 Oncology Response Criteria
Concepts.definition: A measure proposed by Wolchok et al. (Clin Cancer Res 2009;15:7412-7420) to determine the extent of an antitumor response to a particular immunotherapeutic agent.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/23/18 jk chg reg status to Standard for RECIST defined PV list; do not add PVs without checking latest version of guideline.  4/2/18 jk created for DCI study and immune RECIST FG activities.
